sen.j: 阿弥派（あみは）は室町時代を代表する画派の一。
sen.e: Ami-ha group is one of the painting groups representing the Muromachi Period.
Ami-ha school is one of the painting schools representing the Muromachi Period.
Ami-ha school is one of the painting schools representing the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 能阿弥によって開祖された。
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外処理

sen.j: 主に「三阿弥」と称された水墨画絵師であった能阿弥、芸阿弥、相阿弥および、彼らの画風に影響を受けた絵師を指す。
sen.e: It mainly refers to Noami, Geiami and Soami, who were Suiboku (ink-wash painting) painters and called 'Sanami' (three great artists of the Ami school), and the painters influenced by their painting style.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外処理
sen.e: It mainly refers to Noami, Geiami and Soami, who were Suibokuga (ink-wash painting) painters and called 'Sanami' (three great artists of the Ami school), and the painters influenced by their painting style.

It mainly refers to Noami, Geiami and Soami, who were Suibokuga (ink-wash painting) painters and called 'Sanami' (three great artists of the Ami school), and the painters influenced by their painting style.

sen.j: 中国南宋の画風、特に米元章や米元暉の画風を踏襲する作品が一般的に該当する。
sen.e: The painting styles of Southern Song of China, especially the works following the painting style of Gensho BEI (Mi Fu) and Genki BEI (Mi Youren) generally apply.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外処理
sen.e: The painting styles of Southern Song of China, especially the works following the painting style of Mi Fu and Mi Youren generally apply.
sen.cmt: 人名を英語表記のみとしました。
sen.e: The painting styles of Southern Song of China, especially the works following the painting style of Mi Fu and Mi Youren generally apply.

sen.j: が、様式的な特徴は無く、明確な分類も存在しないため、美術史上の概念としての阿弥派という呼称は存在しない。
sen.e: However, since there is no stylistic feature and no defined classification, there exists no Ami-ha group as a name of concept in art history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外処理
sen.e: However, since there are no stylistic features and no defined classifications, there exists no Ami-ha school as a name of concept in art history.
However, since there are no stylistic features and no defined classifications, there exists no Ami-ha school as a name of concept in art history.
